recipes.title: Herbal Tea
recipes.altText: Herbal tea with mint and flowers
recipes.description: A soothing blend of chamomile, lavender, and mint to calm the senses and warm the soul.
recipes.origin: Inspired by traditional European herbal remedies, this recipe is a gentle nod to forest-based teas made for sleep and clarity.
instructions: Boil water in a kettle or pot.
Add chamomile, lavender, and mint to a teapot or mug.
Pour boiling water over herbs and steep 5-7 minutes.
Strain into your favorite mug.
Add honey if desired. Enjoy hot or iced.
tips: Try adding lemon balm or ginger for a twist.

recipes.title: Lavender Balm
recipes.description: A homemade lavender balm to soothe dry skin.
recipes.origin: Commonly used in folk medicine to promote skin healing and relaxation.
instructions: Melt beeswax and coconut oil together.
Remove from heat and stir in lavender oil.
Pour into a container and let cool.
tips: Use before bed to help sleep.
Store in a cool, dark place.

recipes.title: Mint Infused Water
recipes.description: Refreshing and cooling mint drink for summer.
recipes.origin: Popular in Mediterranean diets as a cooling and hydrating refreshment.
instructions: Add mint and lemon to a pitcher of water.
Chill in the fridge for 2+ hours.
Serve cold.
tips: Use sparkling water for a fizzy version.
Add cucumber slices for extra freshness.

recipes.title: Elderberry Syrup
recipes.origin: Used for centuries in European herbalism to ward off colds.
instructions: Boil berries and ginger in water.
Simmer 45 mins, mash, strain.
Cool and mix in honey.
tips: Store in fridge for up to 3 months.
Take 1 tbsp daily during cold season.

recipes.title: Chamomile Sleep Spray
recipes.description: Spray to calm nerves and sleep better.
recipes.origin: Chamomile has long been used in aromatherapy for relaxation.
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a spray bottle.
Shake before each use.
Spray on pillow or sheets.
tips: Combine with lavender oil for extra calm.

recipes.title: Rose Petal Salve
recipes.altText: Rose salve in a small container
recipes.description: Gentle healing salve made with roses.
instructions: Infuse rose petals in oil for 1 hour on low heat.
Strain and add melted beeswax.
Pour into tins to set.
tips: Use on lips or dry skin.
Add a few drops of rose essential oil for stronger scent.
